resources.string: Bubble sort is a sorting algorithm used to sort a sequence of numbers
The scale at the right end of the sequence will compare the number on their left and right sides.
In this case, they will compare 8 and 2
After comparing them, if the number on the right is found to be smaller, the number will be swapped.
8 is greater than 2 so the numbers do not get swapped.
After the comparison is finished, the scale move one position to the left.
This time 2 is smaller than 7 so the numbers get swapped.
The scale move one position to left.
This operation is repeated untill the scale reach the left end of the sequence
The number on the left edge is considered fully sorted.
and the scale is moved back to the right edge.
The same operations are repeated untill all of the numbers are fully sorted.
